content: Paul did a really nice job standing up a project site in time for our announcment
However, one thing I'm still not totally comfortable with is the blurry line between our documentation on github and what we put up on the site
for example, i just noticed that we now have 2 different CONTRIBUTING files...one at the project root and one under docs
in my opinion, that content should live at the root of the project on github
if we want, we could copy it into the site, but i'm not sure how much value that has
I captured some of this in https://github.com/IBM/FHIR/issues/390

things that live today in github are:

  • README.md (content mostly duplicated into docs/src/pages/index.md)
  • CONTRIBUTING.md (content mostly duplicated into docs/src/pages/CONTRIBUTING.md)
  • MAINTAINERS.md
  • LICENSE
  • select module-level READMEs like https://github.com/IBM/FHIR/tree/master/fhir-persistence-schema
I'm thinking to fix #390 by dropping CONTRIBUTING from the site
but unfortunately our landing page has a link to that. and this comes from our README
I'm wondering if we should just go for a clean split. project docs like READMEs and CONTRIBUTING stay on github and we introduce dedicated pages for the website under docs
i opened https://github.com/IBM/FHIR/pull/393 to fix the broken link by removing CONTRIBUTING from the site. now the github repo is the only source of truth for that info.
